name: Physical Protection (Limit physical access to information systems and facilities)

items.question: Do you store, process, or handle Federal Contract Information (FCI) on physical media or in on-site locations?
PE.L1-B.1.VIII - Physical Access Authorization
1. Authorized Personnel Inventory
How many individuals are authorized for physical access to FCI areas (fill in the total for each)?

codeList.display: How many individuals are authorized for physical access to FCI areas (fill in the total for each)?

items.codingInstructions:
Authorized Personnel Inventory lists all employees, contractors, or other individuals who are approved to access areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive systems. The inventory should:

•   Identify Individuals: Include names and roles of all authorized personnel.
•   Specify Access Levels: Document which areas or systems each person is allowed to enter.
•   Be Updated Regularly: Remove people who no longer require access and add new personnel as needed.
•   Support Audits: Ensure the list can be used to verify compliance during reviews or inspections.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Maintain an updated list of individuals authorized to access secure physical areas to ensure proper access control.

items.question: 2. Physical Access Areas
What areas require controlled physical access?

answers.text: Conference rooms used for FCI discussions

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Physical Access Areas identify all locations where Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems are stored, processed, or used. These areas must have controlled access to prevent unauthorized entry.

•   Server Rooms or Data Centers: Physical rooms containing servers, networking equipment, or other IT infrastructure.
•   Storage Areas: Rooms or cabinets storing backups, media, or printed FCI.
•   Workspaces: Areas where employees handle sensitive data directly, if applicable.
•   Other Restricted Areas: Any other locations that require monitoring or authorization to protect FCI.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.

items.question: 3. Authorization Process
Who authorizes physical access to controlled areas?

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Authorization Process defines how individuals are granted permission to access areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems. The process must ensure only approved personnel gain access.

•   Request and Approval: Employees or contractors must request access, which is reviewed and approved by management.
•   Verification: Confirm the identity and role of each individual before granting access.
•   Access Levels: Assign permissions based on job responsibilities and need-to-know.
•   Review and Revocation: Periodically review access rights and revoke them when no longer required.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.

items.question: 4. Access Credentials
What types of physical access credentials are issued?

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Access Credentials define the login information or identification used to access areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems. Credentials must be issued only to authorized personnel.

•   Unique IDs: Each individual receives a unique username or ID to track access.
•   Authentication Methods: Include passwords, badges, key cards, or multi-factor authentication (MFA) as applicable.
•   Controlled Distribution: Ensure credentials are only provided to personnel who require access.
•   Revocation: Remove or disable credentials promptly when no longer needed.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.

items.question: 5. Time-Based Access Restrictions
Are there time-based restrictions on physical access?

extension.valueString: Type your comments here...

items.question: Notes / Evidence

codeList.display: Physical Protection Time Based Access Notes Evidence

items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Time-Based Access Restrictions define specific time periods during which authorized personnel are allowed to access areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems.

•   Access Windows: Grant entry only during approved working hours or scheduled shifts.
•   After-Hours Control: Require additional approvals or supervision for access outside standard hours.
•   Monitoring: Track and log access times to ensure compliance.
•   Revocation or Adjustment: Update access schedules when personnel roles or responsibilities change.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence

codeList.display: Physical Protection Time Based Notes Evidence

items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Physical Access Authorization (PE) ensures that only authorized personnel can enter areas where Federal Contract Information (FCI) or information systems are stored or processed. Access must be:

•   Restricted: Only employees or contractors with a business need are allowed entry.
•   Controlled: Access points are monitored, and entry is recorded.
•   Reviewed: Permissions are periodically checked and updated to remove unauthorized access.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Limit physical access to organizational information systems, equipment, and the respective operating environments to authorized individuals

items.question: PE.L1-B.1.IX – Manage Visitors & Physical Access
1. Visitor Escort Policy
Does your organization require all visitors to be escorted?

answers.text: Yes, all visitors must be escorted at all times
Yes, but only in restricted areas

value.text: Yes, all visitors must be escorted at all times

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Visitor Escort Policy defines the rules for escorting visitors while they are in areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems. All visitors must be supervised to prevent unauthorized access.

•   Mandatory Escort: Visitors must be accompanied by authorized personnel at all times.
•   Access Limits: Escort ensures visitors only enter areas necessary for their purpose.
•   Accountability: The escort is responsible for monitoring visitor behavior and adherence to security policies.
•   Documentation: Record visitor arrival, departure, and escort details for auditing purposes.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.

items.question: 2. Visitor Identification
How are visitors identified and distinguished from employees?

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Visitor Identification defines how visitors are verified before being granted access to areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems.

•   ID Verification: Require visitors to present government-issued ID or company-issued credentials.
•   Registration: Log visitor name, organization, purpose, and entry/exit times.
•   Badge Issuance: Provide temporary visitor badges to clearly identify authorized visitors.
•   Access Limitations: Ensure badges restrict access to only the areas necessary for the visit.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.

items.question: 3. Visitor Activity Monitoring
How is visitor activity monitored while on premises?

answers.text: Physical access restrictions to sensitive areas

value.text: Physical access restrictions to sensitive areas

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Visitor Activity Monitoring ensures that the actions of visitors in areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems are observed and recorded to prevent unauthorized access or misuse.

•   Supervision: Visitors must be accompanied by authorized personnel at all times.
•   Observation: Monitor visitor movements and activities within restricted areas.
•   Recording: Maintain logs or surveillance records to track visitor interactions and locations.
•   Incident Response: Immediately address any suspicious or unauthorized behavior by visitors.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.

items.question: 4. Escort Authorization
Who is authorized to escort visitors?

extension.valueString: Type your comments here...

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Escort Authorization defines who is permitted to escort visitors in areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems, ensuring visitors are properly supervised at all times.

•   Authorized Personnel: Only designated employees or contractors may act as escorts.
•   Role Verification: Confirm that the escort understands responsibilities and security policies.
•   Supervision Duties: Escort is responsible for monitoring visitor movements and preventing unauthorized access.
•   Training & Accountability: Provide training for escorts and maintain records of authorized personnel.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Manage Visitors & Physical Access (PE) ensures that all visitors and temporary personnel are properly controlled when entering areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems. Access must be monitored and documented.

•   Visitor Registration: Record visitor names, purpose, and entry/exit times.
•   Escort Requirements: Require visitors to be accompanied by authorized personnel at all times.
•   Access Permissions: Grant temporary access only to areas necessary for the visitor's purpose.
•   Review & Audit: Periodically review visitor logs to ensure compliance with physical access policies.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.

items.question: PE.L1-B.1.IX –Physical Access Logs
1. Access Logging Methods
How do you log physical access to your facilities?

answers.text: Electronic badge readers with automatic logging
Physical key assignment and tracking logs

value.text: Electronic badge readers with automatic logging

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Access Logging Methods define how entries and exits to areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems are recorded. Proper logging helps track and monitor access for security and compliance purposes.

•   Manual Logs: Sign-in sheets or visitor books documenting personnel and visitors.
•   Electronic Logs: Badge readers, key card systems, or biometric systems capturing entry and exit times.
•   Automated Monitoring: Systems that track and alert on unusual access patterns.
•   Integration: Ensure logs are stored securely and can be reviewed during audits or investigations.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.

items.question: 2. Information Captured in Logs
What information is captured in your physical access logs Information Captured in Logs?

answers.text: Person's identity (name, employee ID, visitor ID)

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Information Captured in Logs specifies the data that must be recorded when personnel or visitors access areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems.

•   Identity of Personnel: Name, role, or unique ID of the individual accessing the area.
•   Date and Time: Record entry and exit times for each visit.
•   Access Method: Note whether entry was via key card, badge, manual log, or other method.
•   Purpose of Access: Optional field to specify reason for entry, if required by policy.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.

items.question: 3. Log Retention and Review
How long are physical access logs retained?

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

items.question: How frequently are access logs reviewed?

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

items.question: Who reviews the physical access logs?

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Log Retention and Review ensures that physical access logs for areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems are kept for a defined period and reviewed regularly to detect unauthorized access or unusual activity.

•   Retention Period: Maintain logs for the time period required by policy, contract, or regulatory obligations.
•   Periodic Review: Regularly examine logs to identify anomalies, security incidents, or access violations.
•   Audit Support: Ensure logs are accessible and organized for internal or external audits.
•   Secure Storage: Protect logs from tampering, deletion, or unauthorized access.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Physical Access Logs (PE) ensure that all entries and exits to areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems are recorded and monitored. Logs help track who accessed restricted areas and when.

•   Record Entries and Exits: Capture the name, role, date, and time of all personnel and visitors.
•   Temporary Access: Log temporary credentials or visitor access.
•   Review and Audit: Periodically review logs to detect unauthorized access or unusual activity.
•   Retention: Keep logs for a defined period as required by policy or contract.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.

items.question: PE.L1-B.1.IX –Manage Physical Access Devices
1. Physical Access Device Inventory
What types of physical access devices does your organization use?

answers.text: Biometric scanners (fingerprint, retina, etc.) Smart cards with embedded chips
Mobile phone apps for access control

value.text: Biometric scanners (fingerprint, retina, etc.) Smart cards with embedded chips
Mobile phone apps for access control

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Physical Access Device Inventory maintains a record of all devices used to control access to areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems.

•   List of Devices: Include key cards, badges, locks, biometric readers, and other access devices.
•   Assigned Users: Document which personnel or visitors have been issued each device.
•   Status Tracking: Track active, inactive, lost, or decommissioned devices.
•   Update Frequency: Keep the inventory current with regular reviews and updates.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.

items.question: 2. Device Control and Management
How are physical access devices controlled and managed?

answers.text: Device return procedures for departing employees
Procedures for lost or stolen devices
Ability to quickly revoke device access

value.text: Device return procedures for departing employees

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Device Control and Management ensures that all physical access devices used for areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems are properly managed throughout their lifecycle.

•   Issuance: Assign devices only to authorized personnel based on role and need-to-know.
•   Tracking: Maintain records of who has each device and when it was issued.
•   Maintenance: Regularly inspect, test, and update devices to ensure proper operation.
•   Recovery and Deactivation: Promptly deactivate or collect devices when personnel leave, change roles, or no longer require access.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.

items.question: 3. Device Security Measures
What security measures protect physical access devices?

answers.text: Device expiration dates and automatic deactivation

value.text: Device expiration dates and automatic deactivation

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Device Security Measures ensures that all physical access devices controlling entry to areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems are protected against misuse, loss, or unauthorized access.

•   Physical Protection: Store devices securely when not in use to prevent theft or tampering.
•   Authentication Controls: Use PINs, passwords, or multi-factor authentication where applicable.
•   Monitoring: Track device usage and detect suspicious activity.
•   Incident Response: Immediately report and respond to lost, stolen, or compromised devices.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.

items.question: 4. Device Maintenance and Updates
How frequently are electronic access systems updated?

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Device Maintenance and Updates ensures that all physical access devices controlling entry to areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems remain functional, secure, and up-to-date.

•   Regular Inspections: Periodically check devices for wear, damage, or malfunction.
•   Software/Firmware Updates: Apply updates or patches to devices as needed to maintain security and functionality.
•   Testing: Confirm that devices operate correctly after maintenance or updates.
•   Documentation: Record maintenance activities, updates, and test results for audit purposes.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.

extension.valueString: Enter notes or supporting evidence, if any

items.question: Notes / Evidence
items.codingInstructions: Provide details, explanations, or supporting documentation for your responses including links to drives or repositories where evidence is stored.

Manage Physical Access Devices (PE) ensures that all devices used to control access to areas containing Federal Contract Information (FCI) or sensitive information systems are properly managed, secured, and maintained.

•   Device Inventory: Maintain a list of all access control devices, including key cards, badges, locks, and biometric readers.
•   Issuance and Assignment: Assign devices only to authorized personnel based on their roles.
•   Maintenance: Regularly inspect and test devices to ensure proper functionality.
•   Deactivation & Recovery: Promptly deactivate or recover devices when personnel leave or no longer require access.

If you require assistance at any point, please utilize the “Ask AI” feature or contact a member of the Opsfolio CaaS team for expert support.
